# setToolbarItems(_:animated:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the toolbar items to be displayed along with the view controller.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func setToolbarItems(_ toolbarItems: [UIBarButtonItem]?, animated: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **toolbarItems**: The toolbar items to display in a built-in toolbar.
- **animated**: If [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], animate the change of items in the toolbar.

## Discussion

View controllers that are managed by a navigation controller can use this method to specify toolbar items for the navigation controller’s built-in toolbar. You can set the toolbar items for your view controller before your view controller is displayed or after it is already visible.

## Configuring a navigation interface

- **navigationItem**: The navigation item used to represent the view controller in a parent’s navigation bar.
- **hidesBottomBarWhenPushed**: A Boolean value indicating whether the toolbar at the bottom of the screen is hidden when the view controller is pushed on to a navigation controller.
- **toolbarItems**: The toolbar items associated with the view controller.
